term.title: α-elimination

item.text: A transformation of the general type: [image: Not defined] where the central atom Z is commonly carbon. The reverse reaction is called α-addition.

sources.item: PAC, 1994, 66, 1077. 'Glossary of terms used in physical organic chemistry (IUPAC Recommendations 1994)' on page 1088 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199466051077)

item.text: General term applied to a reaction by which a group attached to the alpha carbon of an excited chromophore is expelled either as an odd electron species or as an ionic species.

notes.item: This reaction should be distinguished from an @A00004@.

sources.item: PAC, 2007, 79, 293. 'Glossary of terms used in photochemistry, 3rd edition (IUPAC Recommendations 2006)' on page 302 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac200779030293)

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
